reviewText: This movie shows how, in this evil fallen world, Christians are  ridiculed and abused for their faith.Stephen, the main character, is a little boy mocked by his classmates for being a Christian.After a dream, where he saw the persecution of great men of faith such as  Stephen and William Tyndale, his faith was strengthened.The movie makes me reflect how it is important to proclaim the gospel in every hostile circustamce and teach children not to be ashamed of the gospel.Some scenes may be a bit disturbing for little children, so I would suggest parents to watch this movie with them.
summary: Never be ashamed of the Gospel!

reviewText: There will be no acting awards for this film, but it was good compared to other Christian films in that regard. The sound mixing and score would've improved it. For a low budget film, it's fine quality.It's an obvious message (no subtlety), so it's perfect for children ages 6 and up. The movie wants to simplify and drive home a message from the Bible. You might want to watch it first, since it talks of being martyred. Children will come away with a sense of appreciation of the great sacrifices people in the past have made for Christianity.Then it's turned on the modern boys' experiences of persecution--how it's so much less-- and how modern Christians need to stand up for their beliefs in their own type of experiences.I gave it 4 stars for "heart".
summary: Teaches about standing for your beliefs
